website_summaries.verdict: A simple wireless computer with straightforward installation.
pros: If you need a computer with hassle-free installation and speed and distance tracking, this is a good choice
Easy to use, with just two buttons
The computer wakes automatically upon sensing vibrations
Bright LCD display is easy to read
cons: Lacking in features compared to other computers

customer_reviews.title: I love that it's wireless!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the speedometer/odometer yesterday. The physical install of the equipment was easy, and it works great. It's easy to read, even at night.
customer_reviews.author: Gliderdude

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought another
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I bought - have one on mountain bike and now road bike. Very easy install and works great! Instructions are pretty good to follow...if you mess up on the tire size code, just pull out battery and start again. Speaking of battery, there where 2 extras for the screen and also extra zip ties in the box in case you need. Only issue I had so farm with first one is that it was out in the sun and screen blacked out, but once I was able to cool it down, it went back to normal. Good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: amgrassi

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works well, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it says it does. It's harder to find these simple computers now that everyone is seeking something with GPS, etc. I just needed to know how fast I was going, and how far, and this does the trick. I didn't think I needed the back-lit feature, but it's surprising now how often I use it. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Voigt

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought the odometer on 5/20/18. Little trickey to install.On 8/17/18 it stopped registering speed-milage etc. The screen stays lite.I finally remembered that there is a battery in the computer that attaches to the fork on your bike. So i thought the battery must be dead. So, I purchased a 2 pack of A23 batteries, that cost half as much as the device. Neither battery, made the device work. Tried adjusting the magnet on the spokes, nothing. So after 3 months, it is junk. Work great while it worked. I put 480 miles on it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Signal strength is limited to 23 inches or  equal to 60 cm
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised! So far so good just installed speedometer. My intention was to install the sensor device on the rear so I could use my indoor bike stand trainer and measure the distance while indoors training, but the signal strength is about 23" I'm about three to five inches short, do to signal limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. Turned on, stayed on, but never read anything. Stayed at zero. Difficult to operate. Crap. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed- Not Going to Use
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and I am not even going to use it. I should have spent more in the beginning and I wouldn’t have to spend more now. There are 2 different kinds of batteries that come with this and will have to be replaced as used. Nothing is rechargeable. It is extremely light and fragile feeling. The kicker, though, was that it came with wire ties to secure it to the bike. I have a few lights and an iPhone holder on my bike and they either come with those rubber wrap things or at least some Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: Received in August 2018 as backup to another bike computer Ihave on my bike which kept fading out and having to reset after using for 2.5 years. This one was great for 3 months of 10 miles per day riding and then stopped working. Tried all TV ge same things as other commenters (new batteries, readjustment of bike wheel battery and sensor, resetting, etc.) It lights up, keeps time and can be re as reset, but on rides it doesn't register mileage, speed, any other features. I still rely on my old bike computer which has proven to be the more reliable one (same computer, different brand). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SCarr

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate piece of junk: Sensor doesn't "sense" consistently
customer_reviews.text: In the (horribly written, mistake-riddled) instructions it says the magnet needs to be within 6cm (or 60? I'm assuming that's a typo) of the sensor but I had no success in getting it to sense the magnet unless it was 2cm or closer, preferably almost striking the sensor on each pass. This odometer is useless for gauging distance if it won't sense the magnet and record each revolution of the wheel. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: jda2

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions several times to learn button functions.
customer_reviews.text: Display must be mounted near wheel magnet for the two to communicate. I’m using on a recumbent bike trainer and had to mount display on crossbar for the signal to reach the display as this is a wireless unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: 1st I had to look up my wheel circumfrence online. My tire type was not listed on the chart(700x40c). Turns out it is 2200cm. Careful when you mount the computer mount. The arrow goes on bottom pointing up. My unit flunked the signal test in the directions. It tells you to contact customer service for help. I will try but not hopeful. I did procede with the rest of instalation to see what would happen. They are not clear on position of wireless sensor. Best I can tell writting side goes out, lined side goes in. Update: 48hrs and no e-mail back from customer service. Does not work, returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Joan "45"

customer_reviews.title: Worthless instructions!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst instructions I have ever seen. They sent a worthless video on how to program this thing. I have had the battery out 12 times trying to get this set up. I am not a novice with computers. I will rip this thing off and throw it in the trash where it belongs. I have never given a bad review on Amazon before, and I have spent thousands of dollars here.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Truly a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The transmitter was no good right out of the box. Either that or the magnetic sensor was defective. The computer was not gauging any odometer activity while in motion. At first i thought it was the battery so i replaced the battery and it still did not work. I know that if the transmitter is further than 60cm from the magntetic sensor then it will not guage properly, but i measured and i know for a fact the transmitter was not even nearly out of range from the sensor. I troubleshooted using the suggestions on guide, and in the end, this prduct is just a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Da Tod

customer_reviews.title: SY Bicycle Computer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these bicycle computers. When I opened the box boxes I noticed that the protective cover was not on the batteries. The instructions noted to remove the battery coverings. One had parts missing and I returned. It took some effort to set up and position the speedometer attachment so it would work. It is impossible to read the modes riding the bicycle as the letters are very small. The readout is easy to read. I purchased 2 for my 2nd bicycle. After returning the defective one I reviewed others and did not any that appeared to be very different in price range I was looking for. Overall for the price this item works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Borden

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I like the visibility of the screen, big buttons that scroll through the meters, scan feature and the amount of time in between changing its view. I had to replace the transmitter battery within a month of receiving the device and it worked great for two years without a hitch. Then, last September the mph started jumping all over again so I thought “it needs new batteries”. I changed them out but that didn’t fix it. It will jump between 5-23 mph depending on my speed. I get lucky about once a month if it reads a ride accurately. But for the price, what should I expect?
customer_reviews.author: niceville318

customer_reviews.title: Using on my Bike on a turbo trainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to find out how far and fast I was cycling on my turbo trainer. I have a wired speedo on the front wheel so needed something to go on the rear wheel. This works - but has a limited range so is mounted on the cross bar just in front of the saddle. Attached to the cloth protector with three cable ties, 2 through the handlebar holes in the handlebar mount and the third through the two of those and around the cloth protector. Then an elastic band looped over it and around the crossbar to hold in in place . Reasonable solution for <$20. :)
customer_reviews.author: Salmotrutt

customer_reviews.title: This thing did not work at all......
customer_reviews.text: Attached to bike according to instructions....it simply did not work. Period! Returned it promptly, but was charged for returning inspite of the fact that it was purchased and shipped as a PRIME item. Seems it contains a "Lithium Battery," that requires a "Hazard" label. NOTE: It did not contain a Hazard Label when we received it. Hummmmm?????? Cost $4.23 to ship back. Don't buy this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Prairie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Directions missing key elements, but once over that, it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I entered a review earlier with headline "Never worked." My mistake. The directions do not clearly state that one must put a battery in the sensor, although in retrospect, there is a small drawing that indicates that and maybe it's just common sense. But somehow I missed that. Also, the directions do not clearly spell out how to attach the sensor (what side faces the magnet). Maybe it doesn't matter? Anyway, i took a guess, and it works. It took a long time for the company to get back to me to answer my questions, but eventually they did.
customer_reviews.author: OysterJim

customer_reviews.title: The instructions were pretty easy to follow and it works great
customer_reviews.text: All bike computers are a pain to install, but this one a bit less so. The instructions were pretty easy to follow and it works great. I really like that it's wireless
customer_reviews.author: MMMIWashingtonian

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money...
customer_reviews.text: I lost my nice Sigma Sport version and am still kicking myself for not snapping it in right that day! Figured I'd console myself with an upgrade to wireless, but this was around what I could afford. I'm not that picky, so it's okay, but ... there is a slight rattle sound that seems to come from within both pieces -- I could live without that! And, I'm finding the controls are not intuitive and after two weeks still have to go back to the instructions to figure out how to reset the odometer, etc. I hate the scanning feature, but always seem to wind up in it no matter what I do....
customer_reviews.author: groovebilledani

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on rear tire
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for a stationary bike on a bike trainer rear wheel. Followed every step in the instructions and read all reviews to help but item didn't work. Either its defective or doesn't' work on back wheel, even with computer mounted close to magnet. The computer did have a rattle sound to it moving it around so maybe there was a piece that was broken off inside. It is a cost effective computer but feels pretty cheap. Will not be reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: It read a measure like once while installing, the instructions are awful at best but with the pictures from customers here was an easy install, sadly not matter how many times after that I've moved the magnet or the senson around, the system won't read anything. Tried for several hours doing a lot of combinations configuration but not even once it worked. Awful product, obviously not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nehemoth

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.  Even the second one.
customer_reviews.text: Installed the first computer on my wife's bike, and it works OK. The first computer on my bike did not record mileage accurately. I contacted the company through Amazon and they were very responsive, and had me buy a new one for less than $1.00. Installed it, and it doesn't work either. On today's ride the mph kept jumping around from 5 mph to 12 mph even while I am going the same speed. After an hour I checked mileage, and it recorded none of the ride. So, one out of three works. I will toss it and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kayaker GuyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: NO WEBSITE FOUND!
customer_reviews.text: Took a few tries to figure out which button advanced to next program. Also, if you make an entry mistake you must remove the battery to delete the information, then start again from the beginning. Once I got the computer set up, the function where you test the sensor with the magnet would not respond as per instructions. After fooling around with this for a while, I entered the website as directed by the instructions. No website or customer service were found! Decided to return for a refund. Getting another brand!!
customer_reviews.author: Moonfleur

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the YS-368C Model, if you can believe what it says on the instructions. First off, instructions are trash. It doesn't tell you whether to install the sensor sideways to the magnet rotation or off the tip of the sensor. Never could get it to work. Not going to spend anymore time messing with it. I've spent more than an hour attempting to mount the sensor and get it to read with no results. Won't spend anymore time on it. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Donn Cook

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice-Feature Rich-Works Intermittently
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this was going to be a great value but it turns out to be a dud. I even bought two additional ones and had them sent to my daughter and son-in law as gifts at the time I ordered mine. I am now embarrassed that I sent them. It looks great but just does not work all of the time (more not than does). I see the one they have displayed is different than the one I received and also costs a little more. Maybe they were aware of the problem and made some changes...or not. Hope you have better luck than we did.
customer_reviews.author: fmnnc

customer_reviews.title: QUESTION:
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, I’ve installed it completely, but I wonder: if I don’t care about the speed but am only concerned with the distance measurements, can the wheel sensor be removed, or will the unit then not measure anything? Can anyone answer this? Thanks. Apart from trying to get this info, the unit seems fine. I’m betting the wheel sensor and magnet will soon need a more beefed-up custom install; my cannondale MTB bounces around a lot. I have programmed my wheel circumference into the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Jerome Lucas Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to a non-mechanically inclined friend. The instructions said nothing about installing a battery in the sending unit. I told him to look for a section on the sending unit with ridges. He found it but wasn't able to get it off until he wedged a knife down into the tiny space between the cover and the main part of the unit. The the clearance between the sender and the magnet was too small so he had to take the rubber mounting cushion out from under the sending unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Probably works great on a bike - not on a lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: Way too inaccurate on my zero turn lawnmower. Easily could be the ignition noise causing inaccuracy, but for my needs, just didn't do the job. Wouldn't be surprised if it worked perfectly on a bike. and, I'm also sure it'd be easy to install on a bike... not on a lawnmower. Only thing I have as a comment for those buying this for its intended use.... it REALLY small. like, looks like a big postage stamp small. Was easy to read, but it's less than 2" by 2".
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good little computer, faulty installation!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's a real shame this otherwise solid (if no-frills) bike computer has an incredibly weak link...the magnet. For some utterly inexplicable reason it can only install securely where 2 spokes cross, GREATLY limiting where on the fork you can install the sensor which is just really inexcusable. I would honestly say do not buy this for that reason alone. If the seller reads any of these reviews, FIX THE MAGNET PLEASE!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Deckard

customer_reviews.title: Keep track of your trips
customer_reviews.text: While the instructions are nothing to write home about, being basically generic, this little bike computer works great. I was never able to get the clock set, because the options needed to set it never came up, as I clicked through the modes and such. Not a big loss. Other than that, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Siawilin

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Save the environment. This product is so bad its only use is taking up space in your local landfill. Worst product I've purchased through Amazon to date. Should come with a free 2 pound hammer with which one could repeatedly smash this piece of crap into tiny pieces. If you decide to buy this anyway, save the box so you can mail it to a douche bag cyclist you've always hated. So yeah, I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Yes! It's wireless.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is wireless. I didn't read the product description properly (bought it after a glass of wine)! So I was blown away when I didn't run cable. Anyhooo - it's super simple to install and works perfectly from minute 1. I love it. I ride everyday and had no idea how far or fast I was traveling. I do now. And yes - it can be set to metric for those of us that have no idea what miles are.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sleath

customer_reviews.title: Smooth tangle free performance
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work, but the thing is it is nearly impossible to set the mode, especially while riding. The instructions are near non sense. The set buttons just simply don't want to apply the way the instructions indicate. Maybe it's me in my old age, maybe it's defective. It's so complicated it's really too hard to tell.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Sensor was way too big for my bike
customer_reviews.text: I have a regular road bike, but this product wouldn't work for me, because the sensor sticks out way too far. So when you attach it to the fork, it would hit the spokes. I tried to angle it in all sorts of directions, but it wouldn't work at all. I sent it back for a refund and got a different one that's not so bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE Changed batteries and now everything works fine.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After changing both batteries, it seems to work fine now. It registers MPH and logs my miles fine, and now it even turns off (at least goes into standby mode) on its own. All the issues I had with it fixed themselves by swapping to Brand name batteries. We'll see how long it lasts from here. Dead after a little over 1 year. It was never able to turn off, so I'm surprised the battery lasted as long as it did. However, the functions were dicey at best. Some days it would register, some days it wouldn't. Sometimes the speedometer would just get stuck at some arbitrary speed, even when the bike wasn't in motion.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Chang

customer_reviews.title: could not get it to work
customer_reviews.text: This should have been easy to install, but neither my son or I could make it work. I would send it back, but that is too much trouble. It also seemed cheaply made . I wish I had researched it more. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hunters

customer_reviews.title: Following the instructions is the key
customer_reviews.text: This speedometer is everything it says it is and not expensive at all. The key to lack frustration is to follow the instructions carefully (which I did not the first time). Entering the right tire diameter code is the first key step which I did not do right the first time. Then I found it wasn’t giving me my speed nor my miles, after doing some research I found I needed to put the sensor closer to the magnet. After that, it works great just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great For One Hour!
customer_reviews.text: Great when it worked! But rhe computer started functioning intermittently after about one hour of operation. By the 10th hour, it was working about 85% of the time. Adjusting the sensor to an infinitesimal distance from the magnet made no difference in performance. This is the 3rd bike I have placed a computer on, and it was disappointing. I returned the product for a refund. The company has a very good reputation, so I suspect this was an outlier in terms of their statistical product control mechanisms.
customer_reviews.author: Mardengar

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inconsistent in use,  sadly
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install. Easy to understand/ use. However, the numbers are simply wildly variable at a steady state. Smooth flat road, constant speed/ effort and my "speed" is somewhere between 15-21mph. It's just not working. I wish I'd used it before the refund period expired. Useless as without accurate speed, the mileage is also off.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Ver nice for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Thus bicycle computer is quite nice for the money. It has an illuminated dispaly, is water resistant and is easy to install. My only concern is that when I switch modes the display may start flashing. I am extremly happy with the product. It came with all needed hardware to install. The company has been very proactive and provided an installation video and great support. This is very much like a cateye wireless computer but for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: T. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: If you want to use it on your stationary bike without a wheel.
customer_reviews.text: I was frustrated at first. I’m using this on my stationary bike which doesn’t have forks or a wheel. So going with only crank/pedal, if you decide to use it the way I have remember to factor the wheel circumference by 3.14 to get the correct number to enter for your wheel. Now it is working perfectly. I know using it this way negates any return I might ever seek but the price is worth it to get a few more years out of my exercise bike on which the console quit on me. All in all worth the price. I might actually get another for my mountain bike later.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly bell

customer_reviews.title: No return on a product that doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get this product to work, took it to a bike shop and spent 40.00 in labor charges and they could not get it to read from the bike wheel to the computer. Now the date to return it has past so I not only wasted my money on the product I spent another $40.00 in labor charges. Just a bad experience all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: SLL

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit - I miss my Cateye MITY 8
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hoping for a cheap "always on" speedometer to replace my MITY 8 which finally died. I use a Garmin Edge, but with battery saving the screen is usually off so having a simple speedometer to glance at is nice. The wireless sensor is HUGE it won't fit between fork and spokes on my bike, its worthless, $16 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: DCwom

customer_reviews.title: Easy install & works well, had to find updated instructions
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and setup. Wireless is great, worked right away and seems accurate. No issues reading display while riding. Included three extra zip ties in case you made a mistake and had to cut some (which I did), and an extra battery! Only issue I had was the instructions I received did not mention the setup function that shows up after the km/hr to mph setting. This function has a picture of a wrench and allows you to select 200, 400, 600 or 800. A quick search of the model number YS-368C found updated instructions explaining this is the maintenance reminder interval.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Bush

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, instructions lacking
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this works as described. The instructions are very cryptic and poorly written though, and I gave it 2 stars for "Easy to install". For example, changing form KPH to MPH wasn't possible using the instructions. I did find out how by going to the questions on Amazon. The auto wake function doesn't work since it is on always, and I'm sure there is a setting for that but it isn't clear from the instructions. But once I got it installed and aligned, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Feynman

customer_reviews.title: Zip ties are not long enough! And assembly takes way to long
customer_reviews.text: I tried all day to get the zip tie on but it was way to short and now I have to bring it to the bike shop and buy a new one. Another thing is that the zip ties are also stripped and I have none at home. When I bought it I also read other reviews and they said that assembly takes no time. But I have one question can you use it on mountain bikes? Last thing PRODUCT IS TERRIBLE do NOT buy it. And I mean it.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: As long as you know you are buying a $15 bike computer, you will not be let down
customer_reviews.text: As long as you know you are buying a $15 bike computer, you will not be let down. Bought 2 of these for my children's bikes. They do the basic tasks that I was looking for (mph, trip distance, time, clock). With that said, the instructions included are pathetic. They do NOT have any intelligible reason to them. You get the gist of the functions, but need to figure out some of it on your own whether it be the programming & cycling through functions, or the actual installation with the parts included.
customer_reviews.author: Dell T.

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Record Mileage Correctly
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made but what do you expect for the price, I just expected it to work. The mileage is not recorded correctly. I programmed the circumference per the chart it was way off. Gonna return this.
customer_reviews.author: SYLVIA LAMAS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, simple, accurate
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, the zip ties allow a little more rotational movement than my old cateye with screw clamps so maybe suggest installing with some foam padding or something to minimize that. Otherwise there's a minor learning curve to the buttons if you're used to something else, but it works great as a cheap wireless bike speedometer
customer_reviews.author: adamg

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are basically ok but always annoying when companies don't bother hiring native English speakers to ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are basically ok but always annoying when companies don't bother hiring native English speakers to do a final proofreading. The sensor should have a clear mark on it to designate exactly where to line up the magnet which is critical to the function. Nowhere in the instructions does it explicitly say that the sensor which is mounted on the left front fork must be angled in order to achieve a 1 mm gap between the magnet and the sensor. Once one figures everything out, the computer functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Beach

customer_reviews.title: It somestimes works!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product, first you cant turn it off so the screen is always on, waste of battery. It works sometimes, you had to adjust it always, the sensor needs to be very close to the receiver to work. I wont recommend it to anyone who wants to track their trips, training etc.
customer_reviews.author: hulagu

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely dissatisfied. Difficult directions! I wanted to return it, but the communication from them was beyond ridiculous! They just don't understand what I wanted! They wanted to help my profits! Staff member fired, can you remove feedback. Fractured thinking and response!
customer_reviews.author: Patcy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t make sense. I had 3 other people try to help me install it and try to use it. We rode almost 10 miles stopping frequently and it was a huge waste of time. 🙈 it turns on but it doesn’t make sense and it doesn’t track anything.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany N. Long

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Cheap and Poor Engineereing -- Batteries Don't Fit in Compartment
customer_reviews.text: This battery compartment on the main display is not well put together at all. I spend over 20 minutes pressing and trying to turn the back piece back into position and it won't go. There clearly is not enough space for the batteries and the plastic door fully inter-meshed with the threads to properly fit together. It is at the point where I feel a vice would be necessary to make the close and that isn't a good idea with electronics. I'm just returning this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke D.

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive and works!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need this for my road bike, actually mounted it on a Myx stationary bike. While the bike does a lot of stuff, it doesn't tell you your speed or distance traveled. Was very easy to install, once I figured out how to figure the circumference of the wheel. (C=2 pi r) Anyway, works!
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: They must have redesigned the battery cover - with batteries in place, can't screw on.
customer_reviews.text: Avoid - Avoid When you put the batteries in, the cover for the batteries won't screw on. Junk, returned it. Getting a name brand one.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Did not work after one year of use.
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted 1 year.I bought it last summer and it died this summer.I only had 35 miles on it.I changed the batteries but the speed recorder did not work.Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: gerry r.

customer_reviews.title: Unclear instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is probably a good unit but the instructions were less than clear so I returned it and ordered a different one which I set up in a few minutes. It could have been my own fault with the first one but why can't Chinese manufacturers hire ONE PERSON who is fluent in English ?
customer_reviews.author: John N. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Nope, Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked nicely for me for two months of dry riding. But when I was recently caught out in a heavy rain the screen went permanently blank with a fogged screen. Waterproof in my mind means you can ride out a rainstorm and not have it fail. So either remove head unit when it rains or find a unit that is actually waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Cm

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & did what it said it would do
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. I'm just an occasional rider but wanted to know how fast, time on bike, & miles traveled. This does the trick. Instructions were a little difficult to understand but once you oriented yourself with the parts and the screens it became easier. I like the fact that they included an extra battery. I also like the fact that it can be illuminated at night.
customer_reviews.author: Happy & retired 2.0

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate/Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Fits great and easy install, but hardly accurate- overall very dissatisfied. Will be returning. Not user friendly to toggle through settings.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought sigma or cat eye computers. I needed a computer for a mountain bike that I don’t ride often. I just needed something simple that told me the time and distance. I got it 3 weeks ago and installed it. Took it out on one ride on a paved trail and it stopped working. Don’t waste your money. Spend a little more on a better computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Breese

customer_reviews.title: What a delightful little gadget! Get one!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love about this little thing? It works as advertised, and is accurate to the inch!!!! It's worth about 100 bucks, and sells for about 12. A bargain. Note that it's only configured to mount on the handlebar, and not the stem (it would be facing sideways in that case), despite some review I'd read which mentioned some kind of "pivoting mount." No pivoting mount arrived with my unit!
customer_reviews.author: A Guy With Good Taste

customer_reviews.title: SY Bicycle Speedometer and Odometer Wireless Waterproof Cycle Bike Computer
customer_reviews.text: Very cool wireless speedometer :) :) it works great with my razor sweet pea electric scooter All I had to do was measure the circumference of the front tire in inches and use my computer's calculator to get the measurement in millimeter to insert that number into the computer for calibration
customer_reviews.author: Karadaniel

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, would not transmit speed after several attempts to adjust per instructions
customer_reviews.text: Would Not work after installing correctly. Speedometer would not move. Aligned magnet and transmitter as shown in the very poor instruction sheet. Another Chi-Comm Dud endorsed by Bezos !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you have a bike with a wide front fork this speedometer will perform poorly. It is designed for a narrow fork like the old 3 speed bike from years ago. The magnet does not even come close to the sensor therefore it no signal is going to the speedometer. I do not recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing batteries
customer_reviews.text: Range from sender to reciever severally limited if rearwheel is desired for use with bike trainer. Not rechargeable, and it takes obscure batteries. For actual rides, you'll be better off just using a gps app on a phone.
customer_reviews.author: knope

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: The price on this thing said it all. IT was an extra stocking stuffer for our son and for the price, expectations were low. Appropriately so, it never worked. I've in stalled many of these over the years but all were wired. This thing never registered. The directions are in Chinese and then very, very roughly translated to English to the point where it reads like a 3 year old wrote it. Useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Bayman

customer_reviews.title: Great value with all features needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive cyclometer for my bike to get a read out on how far I"ve travelled. Fun to see your current speed, maxium and average speeds and elapsed time with built in clock. Somewhat tricky to install (hubby did it for me) sensor transmitter and computer set up - but he got it done by following instructions; easy to operate (click through) to get readouts. Very accurate as it compares exactly with the distance and speed my companion biker gets using Apple watch app.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy M. Dincecco

customer_reviews.title: Great computer and works well
customer_reviews.text: This computer is a great value. Works well. It gives my speed and distance with accuracy. The only thing I had issues with is when I put my headlight next to it it’s inters with the signal and stops working. But when I move my headlight to the other side of the stem it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Trace

customer_reviews.title: Nice odometer
customer_reviews.text: I have only ridden once since installing the Odometer/Speedometer yesterday. It seems to be accurate and was easy to install on the bike. It came with extra cable ties and an extra battery which was nice. The only problem I had was getting the computer set up. That took me some trial and error until I got it. A little larger print on the directions would have been helpful for older eyes, but that is my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Judy S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service, had defective product.
customer_reviews.text: Update... the seller contacted me and gave me a refund. They do stand behind their product. I might have gotten a defective product. Because of the sellers customer service, I am updating my review and star rating. Original... I put this on my bike and first time using it, the speedometer stopped reading accurately and it eventually stopped all together on the first ride. I am very annoyed that it stopped even recording the speed I was going. I would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Black

customer_reviews.title: Won't last - No customer support - Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and he loved it for the few weeks that it worked. I reached out to the seller with no response. Tried new batteries and it still doesn't work. I don't believe any of the 5 star reviews. Don't waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.text: Bike computer was quickly installed and setup. Instructions are a little sparse, but enough information to do the setup. Computer itself is easy to use and I am able to scroll through the various functions (speed, distance, elapsed time, etc) with ease while riding.
customer_reviews.author: VNETUXA

customer_reviews.title: Covers just about everything you’d need
customer_reviews.text: Accurate on everything but it might be a bit off on the speed. Easy to set up as long as you follow the instructions. Could’ve used a better way to mount the device but the zip ties worked fine for the most part. There’s better options but probably not for the same price. It covers everything you’d need at a surprisingly low price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m not too happy with my purchase. I will update my review if I hear back from the seller. The product I received appears to be used-the face of the odometer is all scratched up and dingy. The sensor is not working. I’ve reached out to the seller so we shall see!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product, IMO
customer_reviews.text: The unit was difficult to install due to the use of plastic snap ties on the sending unit (installed on the front fork adjacent to where magnet rotates in the wheel spokes). The ties do not allow for much precision, and yet the clearance between the rotating magnet & sending unit (max 3 mm) is very important to the accuracy of the computer. A different type of attachment is needed, so that the unit can be set with precision. The speedometer became sporadically inaccurate after only about a week of use. I would never buy a product from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bethesda

customer_reviews.title: Works most of time but problems in high humidity.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and normally works well BUT it's happened twice, in morning with high humidity, it won't work for first few miles then starts to work. I checked distance from magnet to sensor and it's fine. After it starts working, it's fine for rest of ride. On other rides it's fine, works from beginning of ride. Apparently electronics not sealed properly and humidity causes problem.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: No Bargain
customer_reviews.text: The zip ties broke. They are very brittle. Once I got the computer installed, it didn't work. Going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: lovingtucson

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Directions too small to read and figure out. I did not return. It tells me how far I go so it does something for me
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use, doesn’t sense any movement
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these units, and both are so difficult to use, I’ll end up replacing them. Set up was easy enough, but neither unit will read any movement. I would spend the money on a better unit and avoid these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lie about the light on the picture
customer_reviews.text: It's a lie, or I don't know how to put the lught on on the device. I bought it because on its advertising shows it lit up. It doesn't. I fell for it. Otherwise, it's working. I don't know how long bcs it's made of cheap plastic. I had to glue it with crazy glue because the part that house the chip, the lower to the fork, part, came apart when I installed it. For the price, though, I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: marin o.

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Only one thing
customer_reviews.text: This computer works well similar to other models. The programing it easy and correct. the distance come out true. The only thing is it does not have a wake up function. You have to start it up recording yourself. Oh well, good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan DillardTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Instructions virtually impossible to figure out. Only thing I could get to function was the clock, no speedometer , no odometer no moving function at all. ha ha , 15 dollars , should have known better. Will be sent back first thing Monday morning.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D. Hilsinger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing with this thing for several days and can’t get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get them to work. Husband threw away the boxes before I discovered they didn’t work so I can’t even return them. So annoyed
customer_reviews.author: Amanda L

customer_reviews.title: There is a high failure rate on these!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these and I really like how easy they are to install and use, but the first one only lasted about one year before it started reading erratically and then failed. The second one I have is okay so far, but I just bought another one to put on my second bike and it is acting erratically from the start. I suspect that the electronics are very cheaply made and that may be why. The current speed doesn't show up consistantly. It sometimes reads 0 mph, sometimes it varies between 2-14 mph. It bounces all around and goes to zero like there is a short circuit in the system. It is very annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Weege

customer_reviews.title: Easy install...tine will tell
customer_reviews.text: We shall see. All the function work. Nice addition. Have good feelings about this. (Once the initial install and test goes well, it is a good indicator of a good product; meaning the chip did not fail right out of the box).
customer_reviews.author: StacyAdams

customer_reviews.title: Beware .....You’ll need some time and meditation to get this right !!
customer_reviews.text: Vey difficult to install and program many repetitive steps and alignment of magnet sensors very difficult to set up . Instructions are terrible , when finally installed works can’t get to excited about its features . Changes settings on occasion without warning and requires removing batteries to start over programming !!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hermsmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this one  update not so much
customer_reviews.text: Love the unit. Good seller communication. Instructions are accurate if hard to follow. Great price for a nice speedometer Update August 29 2020 Got this in June. Already fritzing out. Seller is great . product not so much
customer_reviews.author: wetduc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for goal setters.
customer_reviews.text: First off, I hate stuff I have to put together and/or install. But, the instructions are so clear that I had this up and running on my bike in 10 minutes tops. It does everything it says it will do as far as I can tell. Most importantly this little device is an encouragement to ride my bike more consistently because I am one of these guys who likes setting goals and it helps me keep up with the time and milage I ride each week. Perfect for me; you too probably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for about the first 10 minutes of the ride
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for about the first 10 minutes of the ride, it will eventually lose connection and not show speed or distance traveled.
customer_reviews.author: Renchan

customer_reviews.title: Very decent device for an unexpected price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 11/16/2017 and installed it my Catrike. While many might find the set-up instructions for programming for the wheel size difficult, I did not find them so. I am very happy with this purchase - the device has performed very reliably, and with the auto-off feature, it doesn't burn through batteries, like some device I've used.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Amling

customer_reviews.title: Faulty unit with poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: When this product arrived we installed the unit on my son's bike and put the supplied batteries in. The screen would display half of the displays set values and eventually turn off. Communication with the magnetic sensor was active as was indicated by the wheels in motion icon. When contacting the manufacturer about the defective product the only advice they gave was to change the batteries. I had already done this and it was not successful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bourbon

customer_reviews.title: Fills the bill nicely
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an accurate and easy to install speedometer on my Trek road bike and this fit the bill nicely. Instructions were so-so but was able to get the installation right on the first try. Very nicely priced as well.
customer_reviews.author: SPEK

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Product is good although not so accurate on speeds. Useful to keep track of time, distance and average speed
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Not Designed for Mountain Bikes
customer_reviews.text: To install this device properly you need quite a bit of clearance between the spokes and the fork, and the magnet has to be installed where the spokes cross. Because mountain bikes have shocks that are very thick, the only one of our mountain bikes that it would work on is the 29 inch bike, and even then it barely fit. For the 20 inch bike I had to go with a wired model. Otherwise it seemed to work fine and was not too difficult to install.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: I just installed and this seems like it will work fine
customer_reviews.text: I just installed and this seems like it will work fine. One comment, however, the wire-ties used to attach to the fork are pretty brittle. Mine broke.
customer_reviews.author: David Baertsch

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your time. If you ride road bikes as a beginner or a regular rider just spring for the cateye or other brands. This product sounds good, cheap and effective. It’s mostly just cheap. Not accurate with speed or mileage and a pain to set tire size.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

product_meta.title: SY Bicycle Speedometer and Odometer Wireless Waterproof Cycle Bike Computer with LCD Display & Multi-Functions by YS
product_meta.description: Speedometer and Odometer Wireless Waterproof Cycle Bike Computer with LCD Display & Multi-Functions by YS
feature_bullets: 【Auto Wake-up Function】Automatically wakes from sleep mode upon sensing vibration in the bicycle. Bright LCD display to easily view ride statistics.

【Multi-functions】Small size, light weight, wireless, waterproof design makes it convenient and durable. This bicycle computer measures speed, distance, and riding time. Exactly what any serious bicyclist or fitness fanatic needs to know for stats tracking.

【Day & Night Backlight 】Provides backlight for easy viewing during dark hours. The backlight will automatically turn on when any button is pressed between 18:00 and 06:00. Please note the slight rattle sound from device is normal phenomenon, which results from the design of wireless automatic function.

【Easy to Install &Use】Simple installation that only takes a few minutes. Easy to navigate interface with only two buttons to access all measurements. Customizable to most common tyre sizes for accurate stats tracking.

【Applicable】Road bicycles, mountain bikes, folding bikes,and other common bicycles are compatible with this bicycle computer. This bicycle computer MAY NOT be compatible with some electric-assist bicycles. If the computer display, sensor, and magnet can be installed within the specified distances device should be fully compatible. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
